meanings.definition: To allocate or distribute (something) incorrectly or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: The teacher accidentally misallotted the candies, giving more to some students and none to others.
meanings.sent2: The manager had to correct the misallotted funds to ensure everyone received their fair share.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf misallotted the presents, putting socks in the toy box and toys in the sock drawer.
meanings.sent4: The wind misallotted the seeds, scattering them unevenly across the garden.
meanings.sent5: The magician's misallotted cards made the audience gasp in surprise.

meanings.sent1: The student misallotted the answers on the test, mixing up the questions and their responses.
meanings.sent2: The clerk had to fix the misallotted labels on the packages before shipping them out.
meanings.sent3: The chef misallotted the ingredients, adding salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: The artist misallotted the colors, creating a painting with a strange and unexpected palette.
meanings.sent5: The navigator's misallotted directions led the travelers astray.
